page.title: 02WISBECH ST MARY SCHOOL
page.content: Wisbech St. Mary Church of England Aided Primary School was founded in 1726 at Tholomas Drove. In 1859 the school was built on its present site. The school belongs to the ecclesiastical parish of Wisbech St. Mary. The majority of the Governors of the school are appointed by the local church and they have a controlling interest in the appointment of staff. The upkeep of the exterior of the building also falls upon the governing body. The interior upkeep is the responsibility of the Department of Education. There are 78 children on the school register. Each child begins school during the term of their fifth birthday and continues until the age of 11yrs. before going on to secondary education. We have a staff of 3.5 teachers and 3 classes in the school.
